title: A river ‘died' overnight in Zambia after an acidic waste spill at a Chinese-owned mine

Markets digest bank earnings after recent turmoil
Still haven't filed your taxes? Here's what you need to know
description: So far this tax season, the IRS has received more than 90 million income tax returns for 2022.

title: Ten detained after North Macedonia nightclub fire kills 59
description: Pyrotechnics during a concert sparked the blaze, causing mass panic in the crowd.

title: Peace deal must bar Ukraine from Nato, Russian official says
description: Deputy foreign minister Alexander Grushko says Ukraine must remain neutral in any peace deal.

title: China announces plan to 'vigorously boost consumption' in bid to shore up economy
description: The plan was to vigorously boost consumption, expand domestic demand, and "enhance consumption capacity by increasing income and reducing burdens."

title: Treasury Secretary Bessent says White House is heading off a 'guaranteed' financial crisis
description: Bessent believes market pullbacks are benign, and Trump's pro-business policies will boost the economy in the long run.

title: Vatican Releases Photo Of Pope Praying From Hospital Suite Chapel
description: The Vatican on Sunday released the first photograph of Pope Francis since the 88-year-old pontiff was admitted more than a month ago to hospital for pneumonia in both lungs.

title: Opinion: Why Iran Is Steadfast Even Under Trump's 'Maximum Pressure'
description: Iran has not left the negotiating table and rejecting direct talks with U.S. is not necessarily an indication of not wanting to negotiate.

title: East African Housekeepers Face Rape, Assault and Death in Saudi Arabia
description: East African leaders and Saudi royals are among those profiting off a lucrative, deadly trade in domestic workers.
author: Abdi Latif Dahir, Justin Scheck and Kiana Hayeri
categories: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

title: The 95-Year-Old Japanese Man Who Is the World’s Oldest Speedskater
description: Iichi Marumo started competing in his late 80s, after a life spent farming, publishing poetry and volunteering to fly in a kamikaze mission during World War II.
author: Martin Fackler and Hisako Ueno

title: ‘We are all Natasha’: senator’s sexual harassment claims roil Nigeria
description: Treatment of Natasha Akpoti-Uduaghan, who has been suspended from senate, shines light on women’s rights Last July, Nigeria’s third-most powerful man gave a rare apology on the floor of the senate which he heads.Godswill Akpabio had chastised his colleague Natasha Akpoti-Uduaghan for speaking out of turn, saying: “We are not in a nightclub”. But after receiving what he said was a deluge of insulting text messages from Nigerians, he apologised publicly a few days later. Continue reading...
author: Eromo Egbejule in Abidjan

title: Marco Rubio says South Africa’s ambassador to US is ‘no longer welcome’
description: US secretary of state accuses Ebrahim Rasool of being a ‘race-baiting politician who hates America’ and Donald TrumpThe US is expelling South Africa’s ambassador to Washington, with the secretary of state, Marco Rubio, accusing the envoy of hating the US and Donald Trump.“South Africa’s ambassador to the United States is no longer welcome in our great country,” Rubio posted on X on Friday. Continue reading...
author: Guardian staff and agencies

title: Iran rejects Trump’s ‘bullying’ on nuclear talks, as threats ratchet up
description: Trump sent a letter to Tehran proposing negotiations on its nuclear program or threatening military action. But he hasn’t waited for a reply to bomb Iranian-allied Houthi rebels.
author: Karen DeYoung

title: Pentagon deploys Navy destroyer for unusual U.S. border mission
description: The vessel is commonly used in overseas missions. The Coast Guard typically takes a lead role in security missions at sea close to the United States.
author: Dan Lamothe

title: 'Back before long': Elon Musk all hearts as stranded Nasa astronauts expressed gratitude for rescue mission
description: Elon Musk expressed his appreciation for NASA astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore, who are set to return to Earth after over nine months in orbit. The SpaceX Crew Dragon capsule has docked at the ISS, and the astronauts will soon return with their replacements aboard.
author: TOI World Desk

title: 'Alien' greets SpaceX crew as Nasa stranded astronauts Sunita Williams, Butch Wilmore await return to Earth
description: NASA astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore, stranded for nine months at the ISS, were greeted by an 'alien' during the arrival of the SpaceX crew. The friendly welcoming came as they prepared for their imminent return to Earth. Their extended stay was due to technical issues with their Boeing Starliner.
author: TOI World Desk
